results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
This film follows a Drayton family road trip from Ararat, Victoria via South Australia to Western Australia with many sites along the way including historic buildings, trams, trains, and scenic views including the outback.

According to Albert Drayton the purpose of the trip was to test the spark plug insulators that they had made up.

A number of town halls and post offices are shown from places visited including Adelaide, Ararat, Stawell, Coolgardie, Gawler and Perth

Also included in this film is a number of scenes with Aboriginal families in the outback.

This film is the prequel to ‘Albert Drayton Home Movies reel 2’. A scene of the Town Hall in Stawell without the clock tower (built in 1939) together with Reel 2 tells us the film was made between 1935 and 1939.

Included in the film are many modes of transport including trams from Adelaide and Perth, steam trains, a tramway bus, cars and bicycles.

A few scenes with the Drayton family show fashion of the time.

The film also shows a few animals from the Adelaide Zoological gardens.

There a few interesting but unidentifiable structures including a wooden chapel in the Araluen botanical gardens and a wooden machine, WA.

Places visited include Ararat, the Grampians, Adelaide, Gawler, Stawell, Nullarbor station, Coolgardie, Iron knob, Kimba, Hovea, Araluen, Eucla and Perth.

Selected Highlights List:
00:00:12:00 – Sister Rocks, Stawell

00:01:10:00 – Adelaide Oval, Athletic championship event with band and St Peter’s Cathedral in the background

00:01:36:00 – Grants Coffee Palace, Hindley Street Adelaide

00:01:38:00 – Close up of Overland Steam train at the Adelaide Railway station.

00:01:55:00 – Tramways Bus, Adelaide

00:03:26:00 –Albert Drayton shaving with mirror on the front of the car bonnet.

00:04:26:00 – Old playground, swing, sandpit and merry-go-round, Kimba, South Australia

00:05:25:00 – Nullarbor Station, Aboriginal couple and Drayton Family

00:07:25:00 –Harold Drayton dropping a stone into a drinking hole, Madura Pass

00:08:38:00 – Drayton family members with Aboriginal families and dogs. WA - possibly Cocklebiddy.

00:09:29:00 – Wooden Mine Battery outside Coolgardie

00:09:41:00 – Coolgardie – dog crossing the main road

00:10:06:00 – Steam Train to Kalgoorlie

00:10:39:00 – London court shopping arcade, Perth, WA

00:11:09:00 – Perth’s number 92 Tram crossing St Georges Terrace and traffic.

00:11:54:00 – Drayton family and Gilmore (friend) having a laugh.

00:12:32:00 – scenes from Araleun Botanical gardens including a wooden chapel.

00:14:37:00 – Chalet Healy Café, Roleystone, Araluen Botanic Park, WA

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
This film shows the Drayton’s trip to Western Australia with a few scenes with members of the Drayton Family. This follows on from ‘Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 3’

The film includes visits to Perth, Ashendon, Bunbury and Kalgoorlie, with scenic views of those areas.

There are a number of monuments to the Second World War visited shown and trips to dams including the Mundaring Weir Dam and interestingly, the Canning Dam, in Ashendon under construction. Given the dam was completed in 1940 and the scene shows it near completion, this dates the film around the late 1930s.

Many animals are recorded including animals of the Perth zoo and scenes of camels both working and relaxing.

The film includes a visit to the Perth’s King’s Park and Botanical Gardens.

A number of different forms of transport are seen including vintage cars, trucks, horse drawn carriages, bicycles, tandem bikes, a train, a tram and a car pulling a trailer along a stony track.

There is also a number of historical buildings seen including the Grand Central Hostel on Wellington Street, Perth; The Wesley Church, Perth; Hackett Memorial Building, Western Australia University and a number of old shop fronts on a main street which also includes the Crystal Hostel.

The film shows the Kalgoorlie courthouse and memorial to Patrick Hannan who was an Irish gold prospector whose discovery of gold on 17 June 1883 led to the foundation of Kalgoorlie.

Finally, the film depicts fashion of that era which includes a distant shot of an old pram.

Selected Highlights List:
00:00:02:00 – Drayton family on steps of The Chalet Healy café, Araleun

00:00:31:00 – Views of Mundaring Weir Dam

00:01:03:00 – Overland train coming into the Perth railway station with a view of the Grand central hostel (backpackers) on wellington street in the background.

00:02:13:00 – Mr & Mrs Drayton standing in front of the Australian War memorial, Kings park Perth

00:02:47:00 – Sir John Forrest Monument, Kings Park

00:03:54:00 – Canning Dam under construction, Ashendon, WA.

00:04:40:00 – Main street, Bunbury, showing old vintage cars, trucks, horse drawn cart and bicycles alongside many shop fronts.

00:05:00:00 – Albert Drayton and mother standing beside the Bunbury war memorial on Victoria and Stirling streets, Bunbury.

00:06:39:00 – Hackett Memorial buildings - Western Australia University.

00:07:45:00 – Mr Drayton saying farewell to Gilmore.

00:08:03:00 – Two women riding a tandem bike, Northam

00:08:10:00 – Kalgoorlie Court House clock tower and Hannon street showing vintage cars the Kalgoorlie tram

00:10:26:00 – Two boys with vintage bicycles - Ceduna, South Australia

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
This film shows the Drayton Family on a road trip holiday across Tasmania to visit Hobart and the Port Arthur Penitentiary. There are numerous views of the scenery and the sea.

The film shows the Port Arthur Prison, Police Station, Asylum, church and the St David’s Anglican Church.

The film also includes Hobart’s double decker trams and zoo with an Emu, Polar Bear, Brown Bear and Barbary Macaque.

A slice of history showing a DC-2 VH-UXJ Loongana plane which was used by the Australian National Airways initially to service a twice weekly trip between Melbourne and Perth. It began in 1936 and was withdrawn in 1947.

Two bridges are shown. The Scamander Bridge and the McGee Bridge, Hobart.

A number of scenes with Navy Ships in them including Sailors painting one.

Two interesting shots are a car which has fallen down a bank and a stone fence with sharp pointed stones on top.

1940s Fashion is clearly seen in the film with numerous shots of family members throughout.

Also shown is the John Hart Conservatory in Launceston.

The film ends with scenes of the family members at home with their pets, a dog and two cats. Also, a kid’s tricycle and Mr Drayton driving an old vintage car.

Original made using standard 16mm film and titled

Tasmania holiday. Home/family. Dad in car.

SELECTED HIGHLIGHTS:
00:00:56:00 – Mr Drayton (father) and policeman

00:01:08:00 – Double decker trams – Hobart

00:01:01:00 – Mrs Drayton (mother) and Roy (brother)

00:02:02:00 – Sailors painting ship

00:02:21:00 – Port Arthur Penitentiary

00:02:58:00 – Drayton family members in front of Port Arthur Police Station

00:03:08:00 – Drayton family in front of Port Arthur Asylum

00:03:25:00 – Albert Drayton

00:03:40:00 – Port Arthur prison building.

00:03:56:00 – Port Arthur Church

00:04:18:00 – St David’s Anglican Church

00:04:34:00 – DC-2 VH-UXJ Loongana plane – Australian National Airways

00:05:26:00 – John Hart Conservatory, Launceston

00:06:25:00 – Child on vintage tricycle with cat and dog.

00:06:36:00 – Albert Drayton drives a two-seater Singer (possibly a Nine, Nine Sports or Le Mans), manufactured circa 1934-1938

results.title: [Air parade]
results.brief_description: Set behind-the-scenes of an American radio station in the 1940’s, this B-Grade melodrama revolves around the escapades of a scheming studio head and a troupe of radio performers aspiring towards stardom and success. The players include, Niela Goodelle, Lee Sullivan, Arthur Boran, Russ Brown, Clyde Fillmore, Edith Gresham, Marion Martin and Johnny Johnson’s Orchestra which is a typical dance band of the era.

results.title: [Adam Tsaktserlis]
results.brief_description:
A passenger on the Murray River Queen gets into trouble when he falls off the ship and seemingly gets eaten by a large fish. Subsequently, the steamer loses oil which drips into the sea.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Accident service]
results.brief_description: The new conception of rehabilitation is shown through the study of the methods (circa 1945) used in treating and caring for injured miners at a well-known hospital and rehabilitation centre in the English Midlands. All stages of treatment are presented. Interesting from a historical viewpoint. NB: Contains some graphic images.

results.title: [A New map for Canada]
results.creator_credit: John H. Tyo, Robert Anderson, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
This film is a survey of Canada in terms of its national air service. Far below a Trans-Canada Airlines (T.C.A.) passenger plane, the new map, a continent wide, unrolls, patterned with high mountains and orchard valleys, prairies with their rectangular grainfields, the Great Lakes and the eastern farmlands. One T.C.A. flight soars over Cleveland and New York; another service crosses Québec and the Maritimes; while a trans-oceanic air liner heads out across the broad Atlantic.
Title and credits missing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John H. Tyo, Robert Anderson, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.description:
This film is a survey of Canada in terms of its national air service. Far below a Trans-Canada Airlines (T.C.A.) passenger plane, the new map, a continent wide, unrolls, patterned with high mountains and orchard valleys, prairies with their rectangular grainfields, the Great Lakes and the eastern farmlands. One T.C.A. flight soars over Cleveland and New York; another service crosses Québec and the Maritimes; while a trans-oceanic air liner heads out across the broad Atlantic.
Title and credits missing.

results.title: [A Design for leisure]
results.creator_credit: Richard Graham and Australia. Dept. of Tourism
results.brief_description: Melbourne architect, Mr Jack Clarke, discusses the need for recreation facilities to be done so that not only will the centre provide the recreation activities required by the community but it would attract all sections of the community. Focuses on architectural style and design.
